daewoo

Wow thats unfortunate.Because I'm ready to take someone on.

 
 Why don't you and Phased21 debate it?
 
 The problem that we have seen with newbies is that often they vanish half way through the debate, which sucks.
 
 Typically there was a 3 judge panel that handled the judging of the debates, so when one side vanished halfway through, it wasted a lot of peoples time. Not too long ago Billsco changed the 3 judge panel idea and I became the designated judge. It just proved too difficult to get 5 people together all at once to pull off a debate.
 
 If you and phased want to debate, go for it. I don't mind judging it. I have a great deal of experience both participating in and judging formal debate and as a judge I am impartial. If you want to try to come up with a panel of judges, that would be fine as well.

 If you want to debate Phased and Daewoo agrees to judge, then you will need to decide exactly what you will be debating in the form of a resolution.
 I would suggest that a simple statement such as "The war in Iraq is good or bad" isn't quantifiable enough. Good for whom? Bad for whom? It's obviously good for the enemies of Saddam, but what about the families of US soldiers?
 Let me know when you're ready to roll and I'll set you up.

 I am just an observer on this thread, but wanted to add the point that there at different questions one can debate about the value of our being in Iraq - one question of whether it is good or bad in general is not enough. The few that come to mind are:
 1. Was it a right decision to invade in the first place?
 2. Now that we are there and things have progressed as they have, is it a right decision to stay for the time being or should we leave now?
 3. Are we running the war in Iraq well?
 
 Anyway, many other posters have mentioned that you need to be more specific. I am just adding my own comments on that point.
